appearances.title: Alex Witt Reports : MSNOW : January 4, 2026 10:00am-1:01pm PST
appearances.snippet: well, joining me right now we have arizona congressman greg stanton. he serves on foreign affairs and transportation and infrastructure committees. congressman, welcome to you, sir. so the administration is characterizing this as a law enforcement operation against drug traffickers, whom it claims are supported by maduro. but the operation involved large scale strikes inside a sovereign nation and the arrest of its leader without informing congress. is this an unconstitutional act of war, and what can congress do to block further military action without its approval? >> it's absolutely unconstitutional. the president has been taking action against venezuela for months now. under federal law and our constitution, acts of war have to be approved by the united states congress. so this is completely illegal. but just think about the context. this is the president who ran in 2016 against the bush family and neo con activity in iraq, saying we invaded without a plan. and guess what? it's now 2026 and this president has taken this action against venezuela and
